intro: Tounatea hondurensis, commonly known as the Honduran tounatea, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, tropical environments and thrives in well-drained soil. Its flowering period usually occurs during the dry season, and it is valued for its ornamental qualities. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
